棜字的基本解释

棜
yù
古代祭祀时放兽、馔或酒樽的长方形木盘，没有足：“设棜于东堂下。”

棜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yù］
［《廣韻》依倨切，去御，影。］
古代礼器。为长方形的木承盘。

棜字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　棜； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页533第06
【廣韻】依倨切【集韻】【韻會】於據切【正韻】依據切，?音飫。【玉篇】几屬也。【類篇】承樽器，如案，無足。【孔穎達曰】棜長四尺，廣二尺四寸，深五寸，無足，赤中，畫靑雲氣菱苕華爲飾。《郊特牲饋食》註：如今大木轝。　又【禮·禮器】天子諸侯之尊廢禁，大夫士棜禁。又【玉藻】大夫側尊用棜，士側尊用禁。◎按《儀禮·特牲饋食》疏云：器本無名，人與立號。棜之與禁，因物立名。大夫尊以厭飫爲名，士?以禁戒爲稱。復有以有足無足立名，棜無足，禁有足。非祭禮，雖大夫去足猶存禁名。至祭則名棜，禁不爲神戒也。

棜字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
棜字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Dim
yù
In ancient times, the rectangular wooden plate on which beasts, food, or wine bottles were placed during sacrifices did not have enough: "Set up under the east hall."

[①]［yù］
["Guang Yun" cuts according to cluelessness, goes to imperial, shadows. ]
Ancient ritual vessels. It is a rectangular wooden tray.

[Guang Yun] Cut according to the idiot [Ji Yun] [Rhyme will] Yu according to cut [Zheng Yun] according to cut,? Yin 饫. 【Jade articles】A few of them are also. [Classes] Bottle holders, like the case, without enough. [Kong Yingda said] Feng is four feet long, two feet four inches wide, five inches deep, footless, red in the middle, painted with clouds and rhombohedral huahua ornaments. "Jiao Special Animal Feeding Food" Note: Nowadays, Da Muqi.　[Rite·Ritual Vessel] The princes of the emperor and the princes abolished the ban, and the doctors banned it. Also [Jade algae] The doctor's side respects the use of 棜, the scholar's side respects use forbidden. ◎According to "Rituals·Special Sacrifice Feeding" Shuyun: The device is unnamed, and the person and the standing number. Confucianism and prohibition are named after things. Doctors are known for being disgusting, and scholars are known for prohibition. There is a name for having enough but no standing, but not having enough, forbidden having enough. It is not a sacrificial ceremony, even if the doctor goes to the full, it is still forbidden. The most sacrifices are called divine sacrifices, and they are not forbidden as the precepts of God.
